result.execSummary:
The defendant Rhonda L Reetz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Issue of Worthless Checks(<=$2500) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.24(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.  On January 28, 2016 Court orders defendant to re-pay the costs for court appointed counsel - $518.00.
Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rhonda L Reetz

defendant.name: Reetz, Rhonda L
defendant.address: N8293 Cty Rd N, Neshkoro, WI 54960

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Payment Plan Agreement/Letter of Understanding
from Clerk to Defendant re: Court-ordered Payment Arrangements

1:09 pm
Defendant Rhonda L Reetz in court.  Defendant stated she has been off work as a result of a medical condition but just returned part-time.  Court orders payments in the amount of $25/month, by April 29, 2016, and May 31, 2016; then, payments in the amount of $50/month, beginning June 30, 2016, through December 2016.  Defendant must contact office before January 2017 to set up revised payment plan.  Court authorizes Warrant, stayed pending compliance with payment arrangements.
Court adjourned at 1:10 pm
FTP Hearing 04-18-2016 for $1,082.00
Payment Plan Agreement/Letter of Understanding
Releasing Funds - $216.08 to Badger State Tire Inc.

2:26 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Jeanne Zamzow.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes restitution has been paid.  Statement by Atty Zamzow - will proceed with plea & sentencing, defendant will plea to the charge with a fine and costs.  DA concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty and as a repeater.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation. 

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 as charged.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Zamzow.  Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:  

-$100.00 fine plus court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.  
-Defendant is to re-pay the costs for court appointed counsel.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court adjourned at 2:33 p.m.
State's
Plea/sentencing hearing at 11-09-2015 02:00 pm

11:21 a.m .  Defendant present in court with Atty Jeanne Zamzow.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Zamzow - was recently appointed and requests a Status Hearing in 30 days.  Court sets for Plea & Sentencing on November 9, 2015 at 2:00 P.M.

Court adjourned at 11:22 a.m.
Status hearing at 10-06-2015 10:30 am
to Atty Jeanne Zamzow with a copy of the criminal complaint, minutes and bail/bond

to the defendant - request for court appointed counsel has been approved.  Court appoints Atty Jeanne Zamzow to represent her.  Defendant is to pay $70.00 per month towards attorney fees and is to commence October 1, 2015 and every month thereafter.
and Order - approved.
records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
9:41 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by defendant requests court appointed counsel and submits petition to the court.  Court questions defendant regarding payments.  Statement by defendant.  Court will appoint counsel and defendant is to pay $70.00 per month commencing October 1, 2015.  No objection to Atty Jeanne Zamzow representing her.  Notice to be mailed.  Address on file is correct.

Court adjourned at 9:42 a.m.
Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.
Status hearing at 09-22-2015 09:15 am
Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

8:38 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his right to an attorney.  Defendant stands mute.  Court enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond and conditions of:  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.  Court will set for Status Hearing on September 22, 2015 at 9:15 a.m.

Court adjourned at 8:40 a.m.
Summary of Restitution - $216.08
